newsitem.title: RUSSIA: City of Moscow to issue 200 bln rbl municipal bond.
newsitem.headline: City of Moscow to issue 200 bln rbl municipal bond.

text.p: The City of Moscow plans to issue a discount 182-day municipal bond worth 200 billion roubles, a city government spokesman said on Wednesday.
Mikhail Chernyshov also told Reuters that Moscow would issue 100 billion roubles' worth of savings bonds aimed primarily at individuals.

Timings for the placement of both issues would be determined after they had been registered in the Finance Ministry, he said, adding that the small volume of both issues was due to the Moscow government's wish to evaluate demand for the papers.

But he said that in the first half of 1997, the volume of the Moscow government's borrowing through municipal bonds could amount to up to six trillion roubles, while savings bonds could hit up to two trillion roubles.
Several Russian cities, including St Petersburg, have already issued municipal bonds to finance their projects.
It is still unclear whether profits from government securities will be taxed at a flat rate of 15 percent or at the usual profit tax rates of 35 and 43 percent.
Bank Moskvy will act as an agent for the municipal papers and the City of Moscow had so far named 39 banks and seven investment companies as primary dealers for the paper, Chernyshov said.
